official_title: A bill to establish procedures and standards for the framing of relief in suits to desegregate the Nation's elementary and secondary public schools, to provide for assistance to voluntary desegregation efforts, to establish a National Community and Education Committee to provide assistance to encourage and facilitate constructive and comprehensive community involvement and planning in the desegregation of schools.
short_title: School Desegregation Standards and Assistance Act
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: School Desegregation Standards and Assistance Act - Title I: Standards and Procedures in School Desegregation Suits - Prescribes exclusive standards and procedures to govern the award of injunctive and other equitable relief in school desegregation cases brought under Federal law. Title II: National Community and Education Committee - Creates a national committee composed of citizens from various occupations and backgrounds, particularly individuals who have had experience in school desegregation activities, which is to provide assistance to communities engaged in school desegregation. Creates a Federal Community Assistance Coordinating Council composed of representatives from specified government agencies which shall assist communities engaged in school desegregation in obtaining Federal assistance for programs facilitating desegregation.

titles.title: School Desegregation Standards and Assistance Act

A bill to establish procedures and standards for the framing of relief in suits to desegregate the Nation's elementary and secondary public schools, to provide for assistance to voluntary desegregation efforts, to establish a National Community and Education Committee to provide assistance to encourage and facilitate constructive and comprehensive community involvement and planning in the desegregation of schools.
